title: If someone is holding an item of mine as a ransom for debts (less than $5000) do I have any legal options in recovering it?
question: Item taken is a computer which is my primary source of income.
answers:
I generally agree with my colleague but with a caveat: the old adage that "possession is nine-tenths of the law" does hold true in many parts of the country. Speak with a CA lawyer familiar with CA laws to see what you need to do to get your property back lawfully.

All the best!

Unless they went through the steps to register their interest as a lien on the property (not likely) then their mere possession of it does not deprive you of your ownership interest. So you could file a replevin action to recover the property (or whatever they call it in California). But they will have a counterclaim based upon your failure to pay back the money. You can find an attorney on AVVO to review all of this with.
